non_compliant.section: YOU EXPRESSLY UNDERSTAND AND AGREE THAT FARADAY AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES, AFFILIATES, OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, PARTNERS AND LICENSORS SHALL NOT BE LIABLE TO YOU, TO ONLY THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED UNDER THE APPLICABLE LAW, FOR ANY DAMAGE, SUCH AS DIRECT, PUNITIVE, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF PROFITS, GOODWILL, USE, DATA OR OTHER INTANGIBLE LOSSES (EVEN IF FARADAY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES), RESULTING FROM: (a) THE USE OR THE INABILITY TO USE THE WEBSITE; (b) THE COST OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS AND SERVICES; (c) UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS TO OR ALTERATION OF YOUR TRANSMISSIONS OR DATA; (d) STATEMENTS OR CONDUCT OF ANY THIRD PARTY ON THE FARADAY SERVICE; OR (e) ANY OTHER MATTER RELATING TO THE FARADAY SERVICE.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Lawfulness of processing, Right to compensation and liability
non_compliant.amend: The GDPR emphasizes fairness and transparency in data processing.  While it's generally acceptable to limit liability, the clause should not contradict the GDPR's core principles.  Specifically, the clause should not waive liability in cases of unlawful data processing or for damages resulting from violations of the GDPR.  Consider adding language that clarifies Faraday remains liable for breaches of its obligations under the GDPR and for damages directly caused by its negligence or intentional misconduct.
